question: Which is the 1000th UNESCO World Heritage Site?
option1: Decorated Cave of Pont d'Arc, France
option4: Monumental earthworks of Poverty Point, the USA
explanation: Okavango Delta, located in Botswana, is the 1000th UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is also a Ramsar Wetland. River Okavango forms this delta. It is an endorheic basin of Kalahari. Moremi Game Reserve is located on the eastern side of the delta. Okavango Delta is one of the natural seven wonders of Africa. After the flooding season of this delta, a special type of land will be formed due to the moisture presence called Molapo.
